channel.title: MBallSectionsDR
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MBallSectionsDR, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Missouri voters and lawmakers clash over who should be able to initiate constitutional amendments
item.description: Missouri voters and the lawmakers they elect could be headed for a clash at the ballot box over the power to set public policy.

item.title: Trump’s Bold Strike Against the Venezuelan Narco-Communist Regime
item.description: By bombing drug traffickers and invoking the Alien Enemies Act, Trump honors the just war imperative to protect the U.S. from hemispheric perils.

item.title: Meta Muzzled Child Safety Findings On Virtual Reality Platforms, Researchers Tell Congress
item.description: 'I wish I could tell you the number of children in VR experiencing these harms, but Meta would not allow me to conduct this research.'

item.title: Russia’s Drone Incursion over Poland Demands a Serious Response
item.description: If Russia thinks NATO is a paper tiger, Moscow must be forced to reconsider.

item.title: Schumer to force vote on releasing Epstein files as part of defense bill debate

item.title: New York AG Tries To Stop Texas From Punishing Abortion Drug Traffickers Who Broke Texas Laws
item.description: New York Attorney General Letitia James escalated her state’s attempts to shield abortion drug traffickers from punishment for breaking pro-life state...

item.title: Hint Of Russia Hoax Accountability: Anti-Weaponization Measure Passes House Intel Committee
item.description: The provision that passed HPSCI Wednesday requires the FBI to notify Congress of any investigations into federal candidates for office.

item.title: Judge Who Freed Charlotte Stabbing Suspect Has Exactly The Credentials You’d Expect

item.title: Black Democrats say GOP claims of underrepresentation in Congress are 'hogwash'

item.title: Dismal National Test Scores Provide More Evidence Colleges Should Be Investigated For Fraud
item.description: While test scores continue to drop, college admissions are on the rise.

item.title: Senate Rules Need Not Delay Executive Branch Subordinates
item.description: John Thune’s proposed rule change is mostly about ending a pointless charade.

item.title: Israel’s Qatar Strike on Hamas Suggests Arab Cooperation
item.description: Clues point to tacit support from Jordan and Saudi Arabia, despite their public protests.

item.title: Intel: (Jean-Baptiste) Colbert and Corleone
item.description: The week of September 1, 2025: Intel’s new role, gold, government statistics, the Fed, and much, much more.
